post.author: Seung Yeop Kim
post.content:
If you think the words \\"free software\\" and \\"AS/400\\" will never be spoken in the
same sentence, think again. There are several places where you'll find free
downloads and open-source projects targeting this platform. Some of the software
you'll find will be more useful than others.

A well-known place for downloadable software -- ZD Net Downloads
(http://www.zdnet.com/downloads/) -- has only a handful of programs developed
with the AS/400 in mind, all running on desktop systems.

At CodePage400 (http://207.158.252.83/codepage400.htm), all the information is
about the AS/400. This site contains more snippets, delivered in Q&A format. The
tips range from the specific -- code for calling validation list API from ILE
RPG -- to the general -- where's the Java tutor?

WyattERP (http://www.opensource400.org/wyatterp/index.html), on the other hand,
is a full-blown application. This is an open-source project that builds an
enterprise resource planning package specifically for the AS/400. It consists of
a suite of functions for back-office tasks, such as general ledger, accounts
payable, accounts receivable, payroll, inventory control, sales analysis, job
costing, order entry, billing and purchasing.

You'll also find interesting software written in Java. The AS/400 has an
optimized Java Virtual Machine and a developer kit for Java that's compatible
with Sun's JDK 1.1.7 on V4R4, so you can use any program that adheres to those
specs.

ArgoUML (http://argouml.tigris.org/index.html) is one such program. It is an
open-source project to build a unified modeling language. The group's secondary
goal is to provide cognitive support for object-oriented software design,
following UML 1.1 specifications. The application is written in Java Foundation
Classes and runs on any platform with Java 1.1.

Written by Amy Helen Johnson, a freelance writer in Seattle.
post.title: E-commerce tip: Free AS/400 software
